alert.note: Alert for St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 27 at 5:05PM EDT until April 27 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following county, St. Lucie. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 505 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Pierce, Indrio, Fort Pierce Inlet, Fort Pierce North, Saint Lucie Airport, Saint Lucie Village, Queens Cove, Fort Pierce South, Lakewood Park, Saint Lucie, Pepper Beach Park, Fort Pierce Ocean Park and Surfside Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
